intro: Alsodeia wrayi, commonly known as the narrowleaf alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Alsodeia wrayi is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
